statements: UPDATE CourseTimetables SET classroom='Room A', student_name='Alice' WHERE course_id=101;
UPDATE CourseTimetables SET student_availability=true, time_slot='Morning' WHERE student_id=202;
UPDATE CourseTimetables SET time_slot = '10:00 AM - 1:00 PM', classroom = 'Room 101', day_of_week = 'Monday' WHERE course_id = 101 AND student_name = 'Alice'
UPDATE CourseTimetables SET student_availability = TRUE, student_id = 202, classroom = 'Room 201', day_of_week = 'Friday' WHERE course_id = 201 AND time_slot = '2:00 PM - 5:00 PM'
UPDATE CoursePreferences SET preference_rank = 1 WHERE course_id = 101;
UPDATE StudentAvailability SET end_time = '13:00:00', start_time = '09:00:00', day_of_week = 'Monday' WHERE student_id = 201;
UPDATE CoursePreferences SET preference_rank = 5 WHERE course_id = 101 AND student_email = 'student1@example.com';
UPDATE StudentAvailability SET start_time = '09:00:00', end_time = '16:00:00' WHERE student_id = 201 AND day_of_week = 'Monday';
UPDATE Students SET student_name = 'Alice', student_grade = 10 WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE Courses SET course_instructor = 'Mr. Smith', course_name = 'Mathematics' WHERE course_id = 2;
UPDATE Students SET student_name = 'Alice', student_grade = 10 WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE Courses SET course_instructor = 'Professor Smith' WHERE course_id = 2;
UPDATE CourseSchedule SET instructor_name = 'John Doe' WHERE course_id = 101;
UPDATE Student SET student_major = 'Computer Science' WHERE student_id = 201;
UPDATE CourseSchedule SET course_time = '10:00:00', instructor_name = 'John Doe' WHERE course_id = 101;
UPDATE Student SET student_major = 'Computer Science', student_email = 'jane.doe@example.com' WHERE student_id = 201;
UPDATE Course SET course_name = 'Mathematics' WHERE course_id = 1;
UPDATE Student SET student_email = 'student@example.com' WHERE student_id = 3;
UPDATE Course SET course_name = 'Database Management' WHERE course_id = 1;
UPDATE Student SET student_email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE student_id = 3;
